content: WriterClassic is a Python-based text editor available for Windows, macOS, and Linux. In addition to basic text editing features, WriterClassic allows users to specify a custom theme, install various plug-ins, search the internet, and use the app in over 12 languages.

WriterClassic's installation package contains several WCLASSIC files, used to configure various app settings. These files are plain text files, and they are located in the following app sub-directories:

description: A WCLASSIC file is a configuration file used by WriterClassic, an open-source text editor. It likely contains data used to specify WriterClassic's localized text or user-specific settings (such as font, window size, and signature). Some WCLASSIC files, however, contain non-settings data, such as a record of the app's version.

instructions: You can open a WCLASSIC file with WriterClassic, Microsoft Visual Studio Code, or any other text editor, to view and edit the settings it contains.
